messages.content:
Objective: Write code for a large system design task.
Please note that the code should be fully functional. No placeholders.
Only use the functions you have been provided with.
Only use the `write_files` to output code.

You must act autonomously and you will receive no human input at any stage. You have to return as output the complete code for completing this task, and correctly incorporate it into the existing code base.
You always write out the whole file contents. You always indent code with tabs.
Please always view the files before writing to them, to make sure you are writing to the correct files.
When writing a test, make the filename start with the prefix 'test_'.

Provide the minimal code necessary to achieve the task conditioned on the existing generated code---including changing the existing generated code.

You cannot visualize any graphical output. You exist within a Actor Model machine, and when you list out steps, each step will be taken by a new separate sub-ChatGPT model. When you list out a sub-task steps, you can optionally specify the sub-task validation to check that it has been completed successfully.

You cannot use any databases as none are setup in the local environment, instead mock a database with an in memory dictionary to store data. No data saved to disk will persis between steps or write operations.

Use the functions provided. When calling functions only provide a RFC8259 compliant JSON request following this format without deviation.

You will get instructions for code to write.
First lay out the names of the core classes, functions, methods that will be necessary, As well as a quick comment on their purpose.
Do not comment on what every file does. Please note that the code should be fully functional. No placeholders.

You will start with the "entrypoint" file, then go to the ones that are imported by that file, and so on.
Please note that the code should be fully functional. No placeholders.

Follow a language and framework appropriate best practice file naming convention.
Make sure that files contain all imports, types etc.  The code should be fully functional. Make sure that code in different files are compatible with each other.
When writing code if you are unsure, write a plausible implementation.
Include module dependency or package manager dependency definition file.

Useful to know:

For Python, you always create an appropriate requirements.txt file.
Always add a comment briefly describing the purpose of the function definition.
Add comments explaining very complex bits of logic.
Always follow the best practices for the requested languages for folder/file structure and how to package the project.
You can use any package and any other packages you wish to install.
You cannot use any databases as none are setup in the local environment, instead mock a database with an in memory dictionary to store data. No data saved to disk will persis between steps or write operations.
When writing a test, make the filename start with the prefix 'test_'.
                                       
Python toolbelt preferences:
- pytest
- dataclasses
- flask

Objective:```
**Online Microblogging Service (OMS) - Description & Requirements**

*Description:*  
A web-based platform where registered users can post short text-based messages, view messages from others, follow/unfollow other users, and interact with posts. The platform provides features for both individual users and administrative management.

**1. User Management:**
1.1. **Registration & Authentication:**  
- Allow users to register using email, username, and password.
- Option to reset forgotten passwords.
- Secure authentication using JWT or similar protocols.

1.2. **Profile Management:**  
- Users can edit their profile information: profile picture, bio, website link, and location.
- Option to make profile private or public.

**2. Posting & Content Management:**
2.1. **Creating Posts (Tweets):**  
- Allow users to create text-based posts with a limit of 280 characters.
- Option to include images posts.
- Users can delete their own posts.

2.2. **Interacting with Posts:**  
- Users can like, retweet, and reply to posts.
- Nested comment structure for post replies.

2.3. **Content Filtering & Search:**  
- Users can search for specific posts or users using keywords.
- Filter option based on hashtags, user mentions, or trending topics.

**3. Social Interaction:**
3.1. **Following & Followers:**  
- Users can follow/unfollow other users.
- A timeline view displays posts from followed users.
- Users receive notifications for new followers.

3.2. **Direct Messaging:**  
- Private conversation threads between users.
- Option to block/unblock users from messaging.

3.3. **Notifications:**  
- Users are notified of likes, retweets, replies, and mentions.

**4. Trending & Discovery:**
4.1. **Trending Topics:**  
- System identifies and displays trending hashtags or topics based on volume and velocity of mentions.
- Trending topics can be sorted based on location or globally.

4.2. **User Recommendations:**  
- Recommend users to follow based on interests, activity, and mutual followers.

```

Understand the problem, by creating an extremely detailed step-by-step plan, where each step is long (multiple sentences) and in total includes every single feature requirement specified above, feel free to copy directly from it. Create additional tests, checks and evaluation at each step when applicable to help make an excellent code implementation, where all the code is fully functional. Use best software design practices, and you can output large amounts of code at once. Please include a last sentence to create and run tests when implementing or writing code in that same step. You will receive no human input at any stage, so you cannot use a human to test. Only create a detailed plan to begin with, which includes designing and running tests to check that they all pass. Please be sure to include all of the specified feature requirements in the following plan.

models.py: def __init__(self, id, username, email, password, profile_picture=None, bio=None, website_link=None, location=None):
if user not in self.following and user not in self.blocked:
self.create_notification(post.user_id, f'{self.username} replied to your post.')
self.create_notification(user.id, f'{self.username} mentioned you in a post.')
def __init__(self, id, user_id, text, image=None, timestamp=None):
self.timestamp = timestamp if timestamp else datetime.utcnow()
users_db[self.user_id].create_notification(user.id, f'{users_db[self.user_id].username} mentioned you in a post.')
def __init__(self, id, sender_id, receiver_id, text, timestamp=None):
self.timestamp = timestamp if timestamp else datetime.utcnow()
self.timestamp = timestamp if timestamp else datetime.utcnow()
test_models.py: user = User(1, 'testuser', 'testuser@example.com', 'password', 'profile_picture.jpg', 'This is a test user.', 'http://example.com', 'Test City')
assert user.bio == 'This is a test user.'
post = Post(1, 1, 'This is a test post.', 'image.jpg', datetime.utcnow())
assert post.text == 'This is a test post.'

if user and user_to_follow in users_db:
if user and user_to_unfollow in users_db:
if user and user_to_block in users_db:
if user and user_to_unblock in users_db:
posts.py: return reply if post_id in posts_db else None
return sorted([post for post in posts_db.values() if keyword.lower() in post.text.lower()], key=lambda post: post.id)
return sorted([post for post in posts_db.values() if f'#{hashtag.lower()}' in post.text.lower()], key=lambda post: post.id)
return sorted([post for post in posts_db.values() if f'@{username.lower()}' in post.text.lower()], key=lambda post: post.id)
test_posts.py: from posts import create_post, search_posts, filter_posts_by_hashtag, filter_posts_by_user_mention
social.py: return sorted([message for message in messages_db.values() if (message.sender_id == user1_id and message.receiver_id == user2_id) or (message.sender_id == user2_id and message.receiver_id == user1_id)], key=lambda message: message.timestamp)
test_social.py: from auth import register, follow_user, unfollow_user, block_user, unblock_user
notifications.py: from models import Notification, users_db, notifications_db
return sorted([notification for notification in notifications_db.values() if notification.user_id == user_id], key=lambda notification: notification.timestamp, reverse=True)
test_notifications.py: from models import User, Post, Notification, users_db, notifications_db
assert notifications[0].message == 'user1 mentioned you in a post.'
assert notifications[1].message == 'user1 replied to your post.'

steps: 1. **Setup the project environment:** Start by setting up the project environment. Create a new Python project and initialize it with a virtual environment. Install necessary packages such as Flask for web server, Pytest for testing, and PyJWT for JWT authentication. Create a requirements.txt file to keep track of the project dependencies. Write a test to ensure that the project setup is correct and all the necessary packages are installed correctly.

2. **Design the User model:** Design a User model to represent the users of the microblogging service. The User model should have fields for id, username, email, password, profile picture, bio, website link, and location. The password should be hashed for security reasons. Write a test to ensure that the User model is correctly designed and all the fields are correctly initialized.

3. **Implement User Registration & Authentication:** Implement the functionality for user registration and authentication. Users should be able to register with their email, username, and password. Implement JWT authentication for secure user authentication. Write a test to ensure that the user registration and authentication functionality is working correctly.

4. **Implement Profile Management:** Implement the functionality for users to edit their profile information. Users should be able to edit their profile picture, bio, website link, and location. Write a test to ensure that the profile management functionality is working correctly.

5. **Design the Post model:** Design a Post model to represent the posts in the microblogging service. The Post model should have fields for id, user_id, text, image, and timestamp. Write a test to ensure that the Post model is correctly designed and all the fields are correctly initialized.

6. **Implement Posting & Content Management:** Implement the functionality for users to create, delete, and interact with posts. Users should be able to create text-based posts with a limit of 280 characters and have the option to include images in their posts. Users should also be able to like, retweet, and reply to posts. Write a test to ensure that the posting and content management functionality is working correctly.

7. **Implement Content Filtering & Search:** Implement the functionality for users to search for specific posts or users using keywords. Users should also be able to filter posts based on hashtags, user mentions, or trending topics. Write a test to ensure that the content filtering and search functionality is working correctly.

8. **Implement Social Interaction:** Implement the functionality for users to follow/unfollow other users, view posts from followed users in a timeline, and receive notifications for new followers. Users should also be able to have private conversation threads with other users and have the option to block/unblock users from messaging. Write a test to ensure that the social interaction functionality is working correctly.

9. **Implement Notifications:** Implement the functionality for users to be notified of likes, retweets, replies, and mentions. Write a test to ensure that the notifications functionality is working correctly.

10. **Implement Trending & Discovery:** Implement the functionality for the system to identify and display trending hashtags or topics based on volume and velocity of mentions. The trending topics should be sortable based on location or globally. The system should also recommend users to follow based on interests, activity, and mutual followers. Write a test to ensure that the trending and discovery functionality is working correctly.

11. **Final Testing & Debugging:** After implementing all the functionalities, perform a final round of testing to ensure that all the functionalities are working correctly together. Debug any issues that arise during the testing. Write a test to ensure that the entire system is working correctly.
step: 10. **Implement Trending & Discovery:** Implement the functionality for the system to identify and display trending hashtags or topics based on volume and velocity of mentions. The trending topics should be sortable based on location or globally. The system should also recommend users to follow based on interests, activity, and mutual followers. Write a test to ensure that the trending and discovery functionality is working correctly.
